channel.title: Help making error-404 on a webpage
channel.description: Hello people. Lovely day innit? Hmm I don't know where that came from... Well I want to know how to make an "Error-404" message on a website. Like the one if you go to something like [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/doesnotexist]www.moparisthebest.com/doesnotexist[/url] or something like that. I have the code, but how do I use it?

item.title: Help making error-404 on a webpage
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Does your host allow htaccess? If so, just make a filename called “.htaccess” (without quotes) with the following contents:

ErrorDocument 404 /path/to/custom404Document.html

Dump that in your root dir and your set. Note that the path is the relative path from the root directory of your site, not the root web directory of the sever.

Read full topic
item.source: Help making error-404 on a webpage

item.title: Help making error-404 on a webpage
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Sometimes, in your FTP console, they’ll ask you to make a error page, if you wish, for the several errors that may occur. I’ll have to check it when I get home.

Read full topic
item.source: Help making error-404 on a webpage
